3/ 2) Miners can choose to not mine low fee transactions to signal to the market to increase the fees. This should help create a fee market. If mining is competitive, this should lead to a good fee market. I'm convinced this will work. I think worthwhile to test on Litecoin.
Seriously. Litecoin has had 2.5 average confirmations for 6+ years now. Go do your own research and stop wasting our time.

I'm proposing an upgrade to Litecoin with a soft fork that will let miners signal their min accepted fee in the block header. This will let a fee market develop without having us decide what the min fee is. Will also make it easier for users to estimate fees. More details later.

For the next release of Litecoin reference client, we will reduce the relay fees from 0.001 LTC/kb ($0.30/kb) to 0.00001 LTC ($0.003/kb). We hope to have that out next week. Once people are using the new relay fees, we will reduce the actual min fee to 0.0001 LTC/kb ($0.03/kb).

Sheesh! My point about misinformed bitcoin reporting is NOT whataboutism. It’s to say that many journos misunderstand all of this — bitcoin, crypto, blockchain, Ripple, all of it! My point is that poor coverage is a function of the knowledge gap, not bad intent.

Do you think all the terribly misinformed coverage of bitcoin over the years is “intentional?” I know many believe that. But it’s not. This stuff is so outside the box of understanding that too few people get it. That’s annoying, but quite different from deliberate lies
